Demos.
tl;dw
#wmfra
.@YassinHankir is looking for a CTO to build a cool app that helps people save smart. Infos at http://t.co/YLIEf7duzN http://t.co/GgTp5Zl6qj
#wmfra is listening to @lambdaphonic ... http://t.co/Ei2h0iGdVo
#rheinmainrocks on stage! #wmfra http://t.co/wOSRWEwaIx
Code isn't poetry, I'll show you why in the next minutes. #wmfra http://t.co/JtRmXr3jCf

Writing code is not an end in itself!
Every line needs to enable the customer to reach their goal.
#wmfra http://t.co/hmkX80pDy4

Code is worthless. Don't get attached to it.
Learn the methods and tools to be able to adapt it as a team! #wmfra http://t.co/2TS5HkwRjZ

Code is static knowledge about business processes and it's outdated quickly.
It must be changed continuously. #wmfra http://t.co/Z079rUxYGs

Code is teamwork!
You need other people to achieve something noteworthy.
Learn to communicate and compromise. #wmfra http://t.co/3lqSZUJoYh

Code is fighting everyday!
In order to cope with the constant stampede of requests learn to self-organize. #wmfra http://t.co/zd4GmnrVdn
Become a master of your craft and achieve greatness by serving others with skill and grit. I'll tell you how‚Ä¶ #wmfra http://t.co/3fwwfnk3Kb

Know your craft! 
Favor
/ readable over compact
/ comprehensible over performant
/ robust over versatile
#wmfra http://t.co/FPdMVMIHlz

Learn about:
/ Software Craftsmanship Movement
/ Test-driven development
/ S.O.L.I.D. principle 
/ Usergroups in your area
#wmfra

Provide for your team!
/ Put the customer first.
/ Protect your team from ‚Äúthe shit‚Äù: you have the power to change your organization! #wmfra

Learn about:
/ User-centered design
/ User experience (UX)
/ Prototyping
/ #FutureOfWork
#wmfra

Train your colleagues and
always be helping!
Look for the hard problems and use your skills to fix them.
#wmfra http://t.co/IpM3ic8Uc9

Learn about:
/ writing blog posts
/ mentoring
/ problems in your organization that everyone keeps ignoring
#wmfra
#wmfraselfie http://t.co/9qRCAOP5UO

Most important: be humble!
You're just a glorified janitor.
Make everyday worthwhile because no one else can.
#wmfra http://t.co/i6mszqkX2N
View from the stage. #wmfra http://t.co/j4jey6VXEl
@schinkenstrudel what? How long is that gap?

That's it! I hope you've enjoyed my talk. Feedback very welcome!

People need to learn that "near-miss" is the modus operandi for self-driving cars: http://t.co/6AoUJfnG0a

@benjamin because otherwise they will run screaming!
The same applied back then when they induced the train.
@benjamin ... it will also reduce the amount of heart attacks.
@Paratron have you seen the Mercedes one during Oscars? No windows.
@Paratron I think he added a buffer for protocol errors and lags in communication. You also would need to prepare for hardware failures.
@Paratron https://t.co/QTapABhnNH

@benjamin because http://t.co/62JaTVksPc
And you can reduce the possible contacts between cars and people to a minimum and where it is ...
@benjamin unavoidable (like in cities) limit the speed and add active pedestrian protection (external airbags).
@benjamin and yes the problem can't be solved. If a car avoids a collission and steers off but creates a new collision that is unfortunate.
@benjamin but people drivers can't solve it either.
@Paratron @martinbuberl may I show you my collection of terminator for coax networks?
@benjamin we need robot justice, of course!
@benjamin practically I as a developer would argue that the KI made the decision and that I am not liable.
@benjamin ... and I'm no lawyer and it will ultimately be decided in court and the ruling will have nothing to do with our actions
@benjamin and I would program them so that other cars would try to force that car off its collision course.
@schinkenstrudel @benjamin of course, until the first car gets its human rights.
